intro: Genista pestalozzae, commonly known as the Pestalozza's broom, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces yellow flowers in early spring, followed by narrow, leaf-like foliage. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native range.
